definition: the person who drinks it knows best whether the water is hot or cold (Zen proverb); self-awareness comes from within/to know best by personal experience
pinyin: ru2 ren2 yin3 shui3 , leng3 nuan3 zi4 zhi1

definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

Every family goes through its problems. (idiom)

definition: one man's meat is another man's poison (idiom)

definition: no use to tell others/let's keep this between ourselves (idiom)

an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)

definition: can be understood, but not described (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); mysterious and subtle

definition: to feel as if it had happened to oneself/to sympathize/(polite expression of gratitude for a favor received by a friend etc) I take it as a personal favor
lit. firewood, rice, oil, salt, soy, vinegar, and tea/fig. life's daily necessities

definition: to know from experience/to learn through experience/to realize/understanding/experience
lit. look into one's heart, no shame (idiom); with a clear conscience
